org.hps.readout

Class ReadoutDataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDataManager

  • public class ReadoutDataManager
extends Driver
    Class ReadoutDataManager is the central management class for the HPS readout chain. It is responsible for tracking most LCSim collection data, for syncing readout data production drivers and their output, for passing managed data objects to drivers as input, for managing triggers, and for writing out data.

    More information on how a readout driver should interface

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Detail

      • readoutWindow

        private static int readoutWindow
        Defines the default size of the readout window in units of nanoseconds.

      • outputFileName

        private static String outputFileName
        Defines the name of the output file for the run.

      • triggerTimeDisplacement

        private static double triggerTimeDisplacement
        Defines where the trigger time should occur within the default readout window. For instance, a value of t means that a period of time equal to t will be included before the trigger time, and a period of time equal to readoutWindow - t will be included after it.

      • BEAM_BUNCH_SIZE

        private static final double BEAM_BUNCH_SIZE
        Defines the length of an event in units of nanoseconds.

      • addData

        public static final <T> void addData(String collectionName,
                                     double dataTime,
                                     Collection<T> data,
                                     Class<T> dataType)
        Adds a new set of data objects to the data manager at the time specified.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Specifies the class type of the data to be added to the collection.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The collection name to which the data should be added.
        dataTime - - The truth time at which the data objects occurred. This represents the time of the object, corrected for time displacement due to buffering on processing on the part of the production driver.
        data - - The data to add.
        dataType - - The class type of the data objects.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if either the collection specified does not exist, or if the object type of the data objects does not match the object type of the data in the collection.

      • addData

        public static final <T> void addData(String collectionName,
                                     Collection<T> data,
                                     Class<T> dataType)
        Adds a new set of data objects to the data manager at a time calculated based on the current simulation time corrected by the total time offset of the collection.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Specifies the class type of the data to be added to the collection.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The collection name to which the data should be added.
        data - - The data to add.
        dataType - - The class type of the data objects.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if either the collection specified does not exist, or if the object type of the data objects does not match the object type of the data in the collection.

      • checkCollectionStatus

        public static final boolean checkCollectionStatus(String collectionName,
                                                  double time)
        Checks whether or not a collection has been populated up to the indicated time.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The collection to check.
        time - - The time at which the collection should be filled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the collection has data generated up to at least the specified time, and false if it does not.

      • getData

        public static final <T> Collection<T> getData(double startTime,
                                              double endTime,
                                              String collectionName,
                                              Class<T> objectType)
        Gets a collection of data objects from a collection within the time range specified.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Specifies the class type of the data stored in the collection.
        Parameters:
        startTime - - The (inclusive) start of the time range.
        endTime - The (exclusive) end of the time range.
        collectionName - - The name of the collection.
        objectType - - The class type of the data stored in the collection.
        Returns:
        Returns the data in the specified time range in the data collection in a List.

      • getIDDecoder

        public static final IDDecoder getIDDecoder(String collectionName)
        Gets the IDDecoder that is used for the indicated managed collection, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The collection to which the decoder should correspond.
        Returns:
        Returns the decoder for the collection, if it exists, and null otherwise.

      • getReadoutWindow

        public static final int getReadoutWindow()
        Gets the default size of the readout window.
        Returns:
        Returns the default size of the readout window in units of nanoseconds.

      • getTotalTimeDisplacement

        public static final double getTotalTimeDisplacement(String collectionName)
        Gets the total amount of time by which a collection is displaced between the actual truth data's occurrence in the simulation, and the time at which the object is actually produced. This includes both the time displacement introduced by the collection's production driver as well as displacement introduced by any preceding drivers that serve as input for the production driver.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The name of the collection.
        Returns:
        Returns the total time displacement in nanoseconds.

      • getTriggerDelay

        public static final double getTriggerDelay()
        Gets the time displacement between when a trigger occurs, and when the triggered data is actually written out.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger delay in units of nanoseconds.

      • getTriggerOffset

        public static final double getTriggerOffset()
        Gets the time by which the trigger is offset in the readout window.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger offset in units of nanoseconds.

      • registerCollection

        public static final <T> void registerCollection(LCIOCollection<T> params,
                                                boolean persistent)
        Adds a managed collection to the data manager. All collections which serve as either input or output from a ReadoutDriver are required to be registered and managed by the data manager. On-trigger special collections should not be registered.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Specifies the class type of the data stored by the collection.
        Parameters:
        params - - An object describing the collection parameters.
        persistent - - Sets whether this collection should be written out to the readout LCIO file.

      • registerCollection

        public static final <T> void registerCollection(LCIOCollection<T> params,
                                                boolean persistent,
                                                double readoutWindowBefore,
                                                double readoutWindowAfter)
        Adds a managed collection to the data manager. All collections which serve as either input or output from a ReadoutDriver are required to be registered and managed by the data manager. On-trigger special collections should not be registered.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Specifies the class type of the data stored by the collection.
        Parameters:
        params - - An object describing the collection parameters.
        persistent - - Sets whether this collection should be written out to the readout LCIO file.
        readoutWindowBefore - - Defines a custom period of time before the trigger time in which all objects will be output to the output LCIO file.
        readoutWindowAfter - - Defines a custom period of time after the trigger time in which all objects will be output to the output LCIO file.

      • registerReadoutDriver

        public static final void registerReadoutDriver(ReadoutDriver productionDriver)
        Registers a ReadoutDriver with the data manager. All readout drivers must be registered in order for their on-trigger special data to be added to the output event.
        Parameters:
        productionDriver - - The readout driver to register.

      • registerTrigger

        public static final void registerTrigger(TriggerDriver triggerDriver)
        Registers a trigger driver with the data manager.
        Parameters:
        triggerDriver - - The trigger driver to register.

      • updateCollectionReadoutName

        public static final <T> void updateCollectionReadoutName(String collectionName,
                                                         Class<T> objectType,
                                                         String newReadoutName)
        Changes the "readout name" parameter for a collection, while retaining all other parameters and stored data.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - The object type of the data stored in the collection that is to be modified.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The name of the collection to modify.
        objectType - - The object type of the collection.
        newReadoutName - - The new name for the "readout name" parameter.

      • sendTrigger

        static final void sendTrigger(TriggerDriver driver)
        Indicates that the specified driver saw a trigger and readout should occur.
        Parameters:
        driver - - The triggering driver.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the argument triggering driver is not registered as a trigger driver with the data manager.

                              String triggerType)
        Indicates that the specified driver saw a trigger and readout should occur.
        Parameters:
        driver - - The triggering driver.
        triggerType - - trigger type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the argument triggering driver is not registered as a trigger driver with the data manager.

        Indicates that the specified driver saw a trigger and readout should occur.

        triggerType - - trigger type.

      • addDataToMap

        private static final <T> void addDataToMap(LCIOCollection<T> params,
                                           Collection<T> readoutData,
                                           Map<String,TriggeredLCIOData<?>> triggeredDataMap)
        Adds a data collection corresponding to a given parameter set to the data map. If there is already data existing under the same collection, it is then merged without duplicating any objects.
        Parameters:
        params - - The collection parameters for the data.
        readoutData - - The data to add.
        triggeredDataMap - - The data map into which the data collection should be added.

      • addDataToMap

        private static final <T> void addDataToMap(LCIOCollection<T> params,
                                           double startTime,
                                           double endTime,
                                           Map<String,TriggeredLCIOData<?>> triggeredDataMap)
        Adds data stored in the collection defined by the parameters object within the given time range to the data map. If there is already data existing under the same collection, it is then merged without duplicating any objects.
        Parameters:
        params - - The parameters for the collection to add.
        startTime - - The start of the time range within the data buffer from which data should be drawn.
        endTime - - The end of the time range within the data buffer from which data should be drawn.
        triggeredDataMap - - The data map into which the data collection should be added.

      • addDataToMap

        private static final <T> void addDataToMap(TriggeredLCIOData<?> dataList,
                                           Class<T> objectType,
                                           Map<String,TriggeredLCIOData<?>> triggeredDataMap)
        Adds data stored in a triggered collection object to the data map. If there is already data existing under the same collection, it is then merged without duplicating any objects.
        Parameters:
        dataList - - The collection data to be added.
        objectType - - the object type of the collection data.
        triggeredDataMap - - The data map into which the data collection should be added.

      • getDataList

        private static final <T> List<T> getDataList(double startTime,
                                             double endTime,
                                             String collectionName,
                                             Class<T> objectType)
        Gets a list of data objects from a collection within the time range specified.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Specifies the class type of the data stored in the collection.
        Parameters:
        startTime - - The (inclusive) start of the time range.
        endTime - The (exclusive) end of the time range.
        collectionName - - The name of the collection.
        objectType - - The class type of the data stored in the collection.
        Returns:
        Returns the data in the specified time range in the data collection in a List.

      • getTotalTimeDisplacement

        private static final double getTotalTimeDisplacement(String collectionName,
                                                     ReadoutDriver productionDriver)
        Calculates the total time displacement of a collection based on its production driver, and the time displacements of the input collections from which it is produced. This is processed recursively, so all time displacements in the production chain of a collection are accounted for.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The name of the collection.
        productionDriver - - The driver which produces the collection.
        Returns:
        Returns the total time displacement for the collection in units of nanoseconds.

      • storeCollection

        private static final <T> void storeCollection(TriggeredLCIOData<T> collectionData,
                                              EventHeader event)
        Writes an entire ReadoutDriver on-trigger data collection to the specified output event.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Specifies the class type of the data that is to be written to the output event.
        Parameters:
        collectionData - - The on-trigger readout data.
        event - - The output event.

      • storeCollection

        private static final <T> void storeCollection(String collectionName,
                                              Class<T> objectType,
                                              int flags,
                                              String readoutName,
                                              Collection<T> collectionData,
                                              EventHeader event)
        Writes the specified data to the output event.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Specifies the class type of the data that is to be written to the output event.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The name of the output collection.
        objectType - - The class of the output collection data objects.
        flags - - Any LCIO flags which apply to the data.
        readoutName - - The readout name for the data, if it is needed. null should be used if a readout name is not required.
        collectionData - - A parameterized Collection containing the data that is to be written.
        event - - The event into which the data is to be written.

      • validateDependencies

        private static final void validateDependencies(String collectionName,
                                               ReadoutDriver productionDriver,
                                               Set<String> dependents)
        Checks that the dependencies of a collection are valid. This consists of checking that any dependencies are registered with the data management driver and also that there are no circular dependencies present.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - - The name of the collection to check.
        productionDriver - - The production driver of the collection to check.
        dependents - - A set containing all of the collections which depend on this driver in the chain. Note that for the first call, this should be an empty set.

      • addParticleParents

        public static final void addParticleParents(MCParticle particle,
                                            Set<MCParticle> particleSet)
        Adds the argument particle and all of its direct parents to the particle set.
        Parameters:
        particle - - The base particle.
        particleSet - - The set that is to contain the full tree of particles.

      • setOutputFile

        public static final void setOutputFile(String filepath)
        Sets the output file name for the triggered data file.
        Parameters:
        filepath - - The file path for the output file.

      • setReadoutWindow

        public static final void setReadoutWindow(int nanoseconds)
        Sets the default size of the readout window, in units of nanoseconds. Note that this can be overridden by specific drivers.
        Parameters:
        nanoseconds - - The length of the default readout window.
